00080 /**

00086 #define PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_REFER     0
00087 #define PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_LRS       1
00088 #define PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_ARCS      2
00089 #define PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_DATA      3
00090 
00091 /**
00092  * \brief   Set the backward threshold of the factor oracle.
00093  * \details This is the minimum size of repeated sequence required to go backward. 
00094  *          Default value is 2.
00095  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00096  * \param   n The backward threshold.
00097  * \return  The number of nodes.
00098  * \ingroup zoulou
00099  */
00100 void pizFactorOracleSetBackwardThreshold (PIZFactorOracle *x, long n);
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * \brief   Set the straight ratio of the factor oracle.
00104  * \details This is the chance to the playback head to go straight for each step in the automaton.
00105  *          Minimum is 0., maximum is 1., default value is 0.25.
00106  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00107  * \param   n The straight ratio.
00108  * \ingroup zoulou
00109  */
00110 void pizFactorOracleSetStraightRatio (PIZFactorOracle *x, double f);
00111 
00112 /**
00113  * \brief   Get the backward threshold of the factor oracle.
00114  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00115  * \return  The backward threshold.
00116  * \ingroup zoulou
00117  */
00118 long pizFactorOracleBackwardThreshold (const PIZFactorOracle *x);
00119 
00120 /**
00121  * \brief   Get the straight ratio of the factor oracle.
00122  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00123  * \return  The straight ratio.
00124  * \ingroup zoulou
00125  */
00126 double pizFactorOracleStraightRatio (const PIZFactorOracle *x);

00128 /**
00129  * \brief   Encode a node to a dynamic array.
00130  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00131  * \param   node The index of the node.
00132  * \param   a A pointer to a dynamic array.
00133  * \return  An error code.
00134  * \remark  An example :  
00135  * \code
00136  * long             err = PIZ_GOOD;
00137  * PIZGrowingArray  *a = pizGrowingArrayNew (16);
00138  *
00139  * err = pizFactorOracleEncodeToArray (x->factorOracle, node, a);
00140  *
00141  * if (!err)
00142  *      {
00143  *          long i, k, ref, lrs;
00144  *           
00145  *          ref = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_REFER);
00146  *          lrs = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_LRS);
00147  *          k   = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_ARCS);
00148  *
00149  *          for (i = 0; i < k; i++) 
00150  *              {
00151  *                  long destination, value;
00152  *
00153  *                  destination = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_DATA + i);
00154  *                  value       = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_DATA + i + k);
00155  *              }
00156  *      }
00157  *   
00158  * pizGrowingArrayFree (a);
00159  *
00160  * \endcode
00161  * \ingroup zoulou
00162  */
00163 PIZError pizFactorOracleEncodeToArray (const PIZFactorOracle *x, long node, PIZGrowingArray *a);

00171  * \brief   Index of number of concepts in \c pizGaloisLatticeEncodeToArray().

00173 
00174 /**
00175  * \def     PIZ_GALOIS_LATTICE_DATA 
00176  * \ingroup romeo
00177  * \brief   Index of data in \c pizGaloisLatticeEncodeToArray().
00178  */
00179  
00180 #define PIZ_GALOIS_LATTICE_CONCEPTS     0
00181 #define PIZ_GALOIS_LATTICE_DATA         1
00182 
00183 /**
00184  * \brief   Encode all the concepts with a given size to a dynamic array.
00185  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00186  * \param   n The size of the concepts.
00187  * \param   a A pointer to a dynamic array.
00188  * \return  An error code.
00189  * \remark  An example :  
00190  * \code
00191  * long             err = PIZ_GOOD;
00192  * long             n = 4;
00193  * PIZGrowingArray  *a = pizGrowingArrayNew (16);
00194  *
00195  * err = pizGaloisLatticeEncodeToArray (lattice, n, a);
00196  *
00197  * if (!err)
00198  *      {
00199  *          long i;
00200  *          long count = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_GALOIS_LATTICE_CONCEPTS);
00201  *          long *ptr  = pizGrowingArrayPtr (a);
00202  *          long *values = NULL;
00203  *
00204  *          for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00205  *                  values = ptr + PIZ_GALOIS_LATTICE_DATA + (n * i);
00206  *              }
00207  *      }
00208  *
00209  *  pizGrowingArrayFree (a);
00210  *
00211  * \endcode
00212  * \ingroup romeo
00213  */
00214 PIZError pizGaloisLatticeEncodeToArray (const PIZGaloisLattice *x, long n, PIZGrowingArray *a);

00283 /**
00284  * \brief   Set the period of node's birth and death in the neural gas.
00285  * \details Default is 1 time out of 2.
00286  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00287  * \param   n The new node rate.
00288  * \ingroup yankee
00289  */
00290 void pizNeuralGasSetLambda (PIZNeuralGas *x, long n);
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * \brief   Set the move factor of the winner node in the neural gas.
00294  * \details Default is 0.5 ; (must be [0., 1.]).
00295  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00296  * \param   n The move factor.
00297  * \ingroup yankee
00298  */
00299 void pizNeuralGasSetEpsilon1 (PIZNeuralGas *x, double f);
00300 
00301 /**
00302  * \brief   Set the move factor of neighboors nodes in the neural gas.
00303  * \details Default is 0.25 ; (must be [0., 1.]).
00304  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00305  * \param   n The move factor.
00306  * \ingroup yankee
00307  */
00308 void pizNeuralGasSetEpsilon2 (PIZNeuralGas *x, double f);
00309 
00310 /**
00311  * \brief   Set the error decrease factor of generators in the neural gas.
00312  * \details Default is 0.5 ; (must be [0., 1.]).
00313  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00314  * \param   n The decrease factor.
00315  * \ingroup yankee
00316  */
00317 void pizNeuralGasSetAlpha (PIZNeuralGas *x, double f);
00318 
00319 /**
00320  * \brief   Set the global error decrease factor in the neural gas.
00321  * \details Default is 0.1 ; (must be [0., 1.]).
00322  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00323  * \param   n The decrease factor.
00324  * \ingroup yankee
00325  */
00326 void pizNeuralGasSetBeta (PIZNeuralGas *x, double f);
00327 
00328 /**
00329  * \brief   Set the utility threshold of the neural gas.
00330  * \details Default is 10.
00331  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00332  * \param   n The utility threshold.
00333  * \ingroup yankee
00334  */
00335 void pizNeuralGasSetKappa (PIZNeuralGas *x, double f);
00336 
00337 /**
00338  * \brief   Get the new node rate of the neural gas.
00339  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00340  * \return  The new node rate.
00341  * \ingroup yankee
00342  */
00343 long pizNeuralGasLambda (const PIZNeuralGas *x);
00344

00351 double pizNeuralGasEpsilon1 (const PIZNeuralGas *x);

00359 double pizNeuralGasEpsilon2 (const PIZNeuralGas *x);

00398 /**
00399  * \def     PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_START 
00400  * \ingroup foxtrot
00401  * \brief   Index of node's start probability in \c pizMarkovModelEncodeToArray().
00402  */
00403 
00404 /**
00405  * \def     PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_TRANSITIONS 
00406  * \ingroup foxtrot
00407  * \brief   Index of node's number of transitions in \c pizMarkovModelEncodeToArray().
00408  */
00409  
00410 /**
00411  * \def     PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_EMISSIONS 
00412  * \ingroup foxtrot
00413  * \brief   Index of node's number of emmissions in \c pizMarkovModelEncodeToArray().
00414  */
00415 
00416 /**
00417  * \def     PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_DATA 
00418  * \ingroup foxtrot
00419  * \brief   Index of data in \c pizMarkovModelEncodeToArray.
00420  */
00421  
00422 #define PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_START          0
00423 #define PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_TRANSITIONS    1
00424 #define PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_EMISSIONS      2
00425 #define PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_DATA           3
00426 
00427 /**
00428  * \brief   Set the persistence ratio of learning.
00429  * \remark  HMM = ((old * persistence) + new) / (persistence + 1.)
00430  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00431  * \param   n The new persistence.
00432  * \ingroup foxtrot
00433  */
00434 void pizMarkovModelSetPersistence (PIZMarkovModel *x, double f);
00435 
00436 /**
00437  * \brief   Encode node's probabilities to a dynamic array.
00438  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00439  * \param   n The index of the node.
00440  * \param   a A pointer to a dynamic array.
00441  * \return  An error code.
00442  * \remark  The values obtained (percents) are approximations.
00443  *          An example :  
00444  * \code
00445  *  long            err = PIZ_GOOD;
00446  *  long            n = 4;
00447  *  PIZGrowingArray *a = pizGrowingArrayNew (256);
00448  *
00449  *  err = pizMarkovModelEncodeToArray (hmm, n, a);
00450  *
00451  *  if (!err)
00452  *      {
00453  *          long i;
00454  *          long start_probability, transition_probability, emission_probability;
00455  *          long t = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_TRANSITIONS);
00456  *          long e = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_EMISSIONS);
00457  *          long *ptr = pizGrowingArrayPtr (a);
00458  *
00459  *          start_probability = pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (a, PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_START);
00460  *
00461  *          for (i = 0; i < t; i++) {
00462  *                  transition_probability = ptr + PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_DATA + i;
00463  *              }
00464  *          
00465  *          for (i = t; i < (t + e); i++) {
00466  *                  emission_probability = ptr + PIZ_MARKOV_MODEL_DATA + i;
00467  *              }          
00468  *
00469  *      }
00470  *
00471  *  pizGrowingArrayFree (a);
00472  *
00473  * \endcode
00474  * \ingroup foxtrot
00475  */
00476 PIZError pizMarkovModelEncodeToArray (const PIZMarkovModel *x, long n, PIZGrowingArray *a);
